name: Missionary’s Downfall
instructions:
1. Combine all ingredients in a blender.
2. Blend for 10 seconds and serve in a snifter glass.
3. Garnish with a pineapple wedge, mint, powdered sugar and an orchid.
description: Adapted from a recipe created in the late 1930s by Donn Beach at his Don The Beachcomber restaurant in Hollywood, California, USA.
garnish: pineapple wedge, bouquet of fresh mint, powdered sugar and an orchid

ingredients.name: Light Rum
ingredients.description: White rum, also known as light or silver rum, is a type of rum that is clear and colorless. It is often unaged or aged for a very short period in stainless steel or other neutral containers, which prevents it from developing the color and flavor that result from prolonged aging in wooden barrels.

ingredients.name: Honey Syrup
ingredients.description: Syrup made from dissolving honey in water.

ingredients.name: Mint
ingredients.description: Mint refers to a family of aromatic herbs known for their refreshing flavor and fragrance. The most commonly used and recognized type of mint is spearmint (Mentha spicata), but there are various other species and hybrids, including peppermint (Mentha × piperita).

ingredients.name: Peach liqueur
ingredients.description: A peach liqueur is any liqueur that is made through the distillation of peaches and has sugar added to it. Peach liqueurs gained popularity in the mid-20th century, but their exact date of origin is unknown.

ingredients.name: Pineapple juice
ingredients.description: Pineapple juice is extracted by passing fresh, ripe pineapple through a juice extractor (juicer) or by muddling fresh cut pineapple chunks and then straining out the solids.
